fields.description: Fix menu extensibility. refer to GUI-1379 as well.

comments.body: [~jloza] asked me to take this since I need to add stack into nav which won't fit currently.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1304
PR 1304 merged.  [~jloza]: feel free to review on the master branch
[~jloza], [~dkavanagh]: Could you clarify in the description what the scope of this ticket is and add the relevant acceptance criteria?
[~kgill] wireframe is referenced in associated UX ticket.

needs CSS, please work with Jenny on desired look.

Also, changed mind about need for text under burger icon, please remove. Wireframe already updated.
[~dkavanagh] please take a shot at the css, ask [~kgill] if you have questions.

Jenny, the updated code is on GUI-1489 branch. I think the menu looks nice. 2 things I would mention are:
 - hover change over the section labels.. unintentional and I should fix
 - on click. browser loading is only indication of a click... should we do more?

Nice job, getting there!

*  need to get rid of instances submenu unless logged in as euca admin
* section headers should be capitalized
* let's screen share again to tweak the CSS, we need more spacing for large touch targets and we can play with hover and onclick behaviors too
* I am also not super happy with the dropdown, I wonder if there's a way to do this off canvas to it opens in a panel but over the content rather than pushing to the side? It really should slide in from the side, cover the content, and be the full length of the visible window. also it seems to have lost the behavior below the small breakpoints. Let's go back to the off-canvas and work on the behavior there, please.

I've changed the nav menu as in the 2nd screenshot. It may still be a little "tight". Let me know what you think. More space is easy to add. Passing this for UX review. The changes are in the GUI-1489 branch, so you can kill 2 review birds with 1 stone!

Just tested on Chrome on Android and it works, but the nav is too tight for mobile. I'll add a little more space.
Screenshot attached. Very workable on my phone (which is small by today's standards).

getting there!

* indentation is not consistent among first-level items...every one below images seems to be indented more, if you can push those back to be aligned with Dash and Images that would be great (done)
* is it possible to differentiate headers that are clickable (dash, images, sometimes instances) from those that are not (the rest?) Either remove highlight and cursor change on those, or let me know if you can't and we'll figure something else out.  (done, no highlighting of those)
* also note that case is not correct for subsection options. See wireframe (done)
pushed fixes back to GUI-1489 branch
UX review passed, ready for code review
Latest PR for updated nav work is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1346

iteration of UX, since we have time in 4.2 to do something more usable and better. https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Nav%2C+footer

Should work like http://www.gv.com/design/, except for on hover: don't move main content,overlap it please. 

Don't use black background, though.
reopening for iteration
[~dkavanagh], if you open a feature branch and let me know what it is, I'll push the icons for you. :)
[~jloza], just created GUI-1474 branch you can push them to.
icons pushed. May want to open separate user story ticket for adding "recent items" to nav, as post-MVP.
[~jloza], missing stacks, launch configs icons, AFAIK
Added LC ones, getting stacks for you, please stand by.
Pushed stacks icons.

In looking to see if there was a sidenav library published, I found this link: http://www.google.com/design/spec/patterns/navigation-drawer.html#navigation-drawer-behavior where the "mini variant" is much like we're spec-ing.
The gv site has a SideNav javascript library embedded, which was easy to extract and I may try re-using as much as possible since it also supports mobile usage.

todo list:
 - enable scrolling on expanded menu since browser is often not tall enough to show entire nav (done)
 - adjust main content area so it doesn't go under collapsed left nav when window sizes smaller. (done)
 - make entire highlighted list item clickable and ensure icon/text show blue when hovering over list item (done)
 - remove left-nav from login page (done)
 - browser zoom affects nav in a bad way. (didn't notice this on chrome or FF anymore)

Quite a few tweaks this morning to prefect the look. The only thing I'm not able to achieve is getting the icon to show highlighted when hovering over the link. Spent quite a bit of time researching and trying things. I suggest we punt that for now so this can be merged. Pls write a ticket about that if you'd like that tracked separately (or I can).
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1455

on hover: let's do just gray box only, no blue in icon or text.

selected option: include gray box, make text blue and icon blue. 

most recent items: nothing should be blue when you're on that page, just one thing int he nav bar should be blue at a time. 

AWESOME job.
OK, I think we should be set!

Looks groovy, [~dkavanagh]! UX review passed, ready for code review. 

[~kgill], if you could review sooner rather than later that would be amazing. I know [~mcrawford] is itching to get his hands on this and once it's merged he can grab a nightly.

[~jloza]: I noticed a bunch of Jenkins failures due to the nav id changes, so I pushed a commit (http://git.io/vqK9v) to fix those and try to get Jenkins to pass.  Stay tuned.

BTW, I tested the new nav on Chrome on my Android (Lollipop) phone and the most recent items don't seem to work there (they always show a blank space about 3 lines tall).  Is that something we should fix here, or should we open a separate ticket for that?

/cc [~dkavanagh]

I fixed the Jenkins Python tests for nav and Alice said not to worry about the volumes/snapshots/ipaddrs tests since those would soon be in python.

IE11 note: hr under most recent is shifted far right in nav bar, so it doesn't show at all when nav is collapsed.

When Jenny and I talked about mobile, she said we could fix that stuff later.

[~dkavanagh]: Copy on the selenium and mobile notes.  I'll open a ticket for the mobile display issue.  Should I punt this back to you to fix the IE11 issue or are we opening a separate ticket for that?

I will fix the IE issues this morning.
I checked again and saw the "most recent" part of the nav isn't functioning properly on  mobile, so I will fix that as well. The mobile issues we thought we could defer were much more minor.
PR 1455 merged

This is working.  I tested on IE, Firefox and Chrome
